action.action-desc: Mr. Panetta (for himself and Mr. Obernolte) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to make powered-lift aircraft eligible for certain exemptions from taxes on air transportation.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Advanced Air Mobility Tax Exemption Parity Act of 2023.

section.header: Powered-lift aircraft made eligible for certain exemptions from taxes on air transportation

subsection.header: Exemption for mining and timber uses
subsection.text: Section 4261(f) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by inserting or powered-lift aircraft after helicopter,
in paragraph (2), by striking or by fixed-wing aircraft and inserting , powered-lift aircraft, or fixed-wing aircraft,, and

subparagraph.text: by striking helicopter or fixed-wing aircraft and inserting helicopter, powered-lift aircraft, or fixed-wing aircraft, and
by striking helicopter transportation and inserting helicopter or powered-lift aircraft transportation.

subsection.text: Section 4261(g)(1) of such Code is amended by inserting or powered-lift aircraft after helicopter.
Section 4261 of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:
For purposes of this section, the term powered-lift aircraft means a heavier-than-air aircraft which—

paragraph.text: is capable of vertical takeoff, vertical landing, and low speed flight,
depends principally on engine-driven lift devices or engine thrust for lift during flight maneuvers described in paragraph (1), and
depends principally on one or more non-rotating airfoils for lift during horizontal flight.

subsection.text: In the case of any exemption from the taxes imposed under section 4261 or 4271 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 which is provided under any regulation or other guidance issued by the Secretary of the Treasury (or the Secretary’s delegate) with respect to transportation by helicopter or fixed-wing aircraft—

paragraph.text: such exemption shall also apply to powered-lift aircraft (as defined in section 4261(l) of such Code (as added by this section), and
such Secretary (or delegate) shall modify such regulation or other guidance consistent with the purposes of paragraph (1).
The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the first day of the first calendar quarter beginning more than 60 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.
Subsection (d) shall take effect as if such subsection were an amendment to which paragraph (1) applies.
